content:
TITLE: Docker Compose Configuration for Dozzle
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration to run Dozzle as a service with necessary volume mounts and port mappings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Dozzle Container with Docker
DESCRIPTION: Docker run command to start Dozzle container with Docker socket mounted and port exposed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker run --name dozzle -d --volume=/var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -p 8080:8080 amir20/dozzle:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Docker Compose Configuration for Dozzle
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose YAML configuration for running Dozzle with proper volume mounts and port exposure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    container_name: dozzle
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Dozzle with Docker CLI
DESCRIPTION: Simple Docker run command to start Dozzle container with docker.sock mount and port mapping.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run -d -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -p 8080:8080 amir20/dozzle:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring User Authentication in YAML Format
DESCRIPTION: Example of a YAML configuration file for file-based user management in Dozzle. This file defines users with their credentials and access filters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/authentication.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
users:
  # "admin" here is username
  admin:
    email: me@email.net
    name: Admin
    # Generate with docker run run -it --rm amir20/dozzle generate --name Admin --email me@email.net --password secret admin
    password: $2a$11$9ho4vY2LdJ/WBopFcsAS0uORC0x2vuFHQgT/yBqZyzclhHsoaIkzK
    filter:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pulling Dozzle Docker Image
DESCRIPTION: Command to pull the latest Dozzle Docker image from Docker Hub.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker pull amir20/dozzle:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring RBAC and Deployment for Dozzle in Kubernetes
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration that sets up the necessary RBAC permissions, deployment, and service for running Dozzle in Kubernetes mode. It includes a service account, cluster role, cluster role binding, deployment specification, and service definition.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/k8s.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
# rbac.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: ServiceAccount
metadata:
  name: pod-viewer
---
# clusterrole.yaml
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: ClusterRole
metadata:
  name: pod-viewer-role
rules:
  - apiGroups: [""]
    resources: ["pods", "pods/log", "nodes"]
    verbs: ["get", "list", "watch"]
  - apiGroups: ["metrics.k8s.io"]
    resources: ["pods"]
    verbs: ["get", "list"]
---
# clusterrolebinding.yaml
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: ClusterRoleBinding
metadata:
  name: pod-viewer-binding
subjects:
  - kind: ServiceAccount
    name: pod-viewer
    namespace: default
roleRef:
  kind: ClusterRole
  name: pod-viewer-role
  apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io
---
# deployment.yaml
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dozzle
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: dozzle
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: dozzle
    spec:
      serviceAccountName: pod-viewer
      containers:
        - name: dozzle
          image: amir20/dozzle:latest
          ports:
            - containerPort: 8080
          env:
            - name: DOZZLE_MODE
              value: "k8s"
---
# service.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: dozzle-service
spec:
  type: ClusterIP
  selector:
    app: dozzle
  ports:
    - port: 8080
      targetPort: 8080
      protocol: TCP
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Kubernetes Configuration for Dozzle
DESCRIPTION: Complete Kubernetes configuration including RBAC setup, ServiceAccount, ClusterRole, ClusterRoleBinding, and Deployment manifests for Dozzle.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
apiVersion: v1
kind: ServiceAccount
metadata:
  name: pod-viewer
---
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: ClusterRole
metadata:
  name: pod-viewer-role
rules:
  - apiGroups: [""]
    resources: ["pods", "pods/log", "nodes"]
    verbs: ["get", "list", "watch"]
  - apiGroups: ["metrics.k8s.io"]
    resources: ["pods"]
    verbs: ["get", "list"]
---
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: ClusterRoleBinding
metadata:
  name: pod-viewer-binding
subjects:
  - kind: ServiceAccount
    name: pod-viewer
    namespace: default
roleRef:
  kind: ClusterRole
  name: pod-viewer-role
  apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io
---
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dozzle
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: dozzle
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: dozzle
    spec:
      serviceAccountName: pod-viewer
      containers:
        - name: dozzle
          image: amir20/dozzle:latest
          ports:
            - containerPort: 8080
          env:
            - name: DOZZLE_MODE
              value: "k8s"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying Dozzle in Docker Swarm Mode
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration deploys Dozzle on every node in the swarm using global mode. It sets up the necessary environment variables, volumes, and network configuration for Swarm Mode.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/swarm-mode.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    environment:
      - DOZZLE_MODE=swarm
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    networks:
      - dozzle
    deploy:
      mode: global
networks:
  dozzle:
    driver: overlay
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Dozzle Docker Swarm Stack Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Docker Swarm stack configuration for running Dozzle in global mode across all nodes with overlay network.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    environment:
      - DOZZLE_MODE=swarm
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    networks:
      - dozzle
    deploy:
      mode: global
networks:
  dozzle:
    driver: overlay
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Connecting to Remote Docker Hosts with TLS Using Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for running Dozzle with TLS certificates to monitor remote Docker hosts. The remote hosts are specified as a comma-separated environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/remote-hosts.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
      - /path/to/certs:/certs
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    environment:
      DOZZLE_REMOTE_HOST: tcp://167.99.1.1:2376,tcp://167.99.1.2:2376
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Dozzle in Swarm Mode
DESCRIPTION: Docker service create command to deploy Dozzle as a global service in Docker Swarm mode.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker service create --name dozzle --env DOZZLE_MODE=swarm --mode global --mount type=bind,source=/var/run/docker.sock,target=/var/run/docker.sock -p 8080:8080 amir20/dozzle:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Authelia for Dozzle Authentication
DESCRIPTION: Complete Authelia YAML configuration file that sets up authentication for Dozzle. Includes jwt secrets, server settings, authentication backend, access control policies, session management, and storage configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/authentication.md#2025-04-21_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
jwt_secret: a_very_important_secret
default_redirection_url: https://public.example.com

server:
  host: 0.0.0.0
  port: 9091

log:
  level: info

totp:
  issuer: authelia.com

authentication_backend:
  file:
    path: /config/users_database.yml

access_control:
  default_policy: deny
  rules:
    - domain: traefik.example.com
      policy: one_factor
    - domain: dozzle.example.com
      policy: one_factor

session:
  secret: unsecure_session_secret
  domain: example.com # Should match whatever your root protected domain is

regulation:
  max_retries: 3
  find_time: 120
  ban_time: 300

storage:
  encryption_key: you_must_generate_a_random_string_of_more_than_twenty_chars_and_configure_this
  local:
    path: /config/db.sqlite3

notifier:
  filesystem:
    filename: /config/notification.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Dozzle Agent with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for running a Dozzle agent with socket mount and port exposure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/agent.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle-agent:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    command: agent
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro
    ports:
      - 7007:7007
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Dozzle with Shell Access in Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: This docker-compose configuration sets up Dozzle with shell access enabled. It mounts the Docker socket, exposes port 8080, and sets the DOZZLE_ENABLE_SHELL environment variable to true.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/shell.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    environment:
      DOZZLE_ENABLE_SHELL: true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Dozzle Agent with Docker CLI
DESCRIPTION: Basic command to start a Dozzle agent using Docker run command. Mounts Docker socket and exposes port 7007.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/agent.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -p 7007:7007 amir20/dozzle:latest agent
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Extended Cookie Lifetime with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for Dozzle with simple authentication and extended cookie TTL of 48 hours for longer user sessions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/authentication.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
      - /path/to/dozzle/data:/data
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    environment:
      DOZZLE_AUTH_PROVIDER: simple
      DOZZLE_AUTH_TTL: 48h
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Dozzle in Agent Mode
DESCRIPTION: Docker run command to start Dozzle in agent mode for monitoring multiple Docker hosts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker run -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -p 7007:7007 amir20/dozzle:latest agent
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Dozzle with Custom Base Path in Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: This Docker Compose configuration sets up Dozzle with a custom base path '/foobar' using the DOZZLE_BASE environment variable. It mounts the Docker socket and exposes port 8080.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/changing-base.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    environment:
      DOZZLE_BASE: /foobar
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Dozzle with File-Based Authentication via CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command-line example for running Dozzle with simple file-based authentication, mounting the necessary volumes for Docker socket access and user data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/authentication.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ docker run -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v /path/to/dozzle/data:/data -p 8080:8080 amir20/dozzle --auth-provider simple
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Container Groups in Dozzle using Docker CLI and Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Examples showing how to add the dev.dozzle.group label to containers to create custom groups in Dozzle. The first example uses Docker CLI to run a container with a custom group label, and the second uses Docker Compose with the same labeling approach.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/container-groups.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run --label dev.dozzle.group=myapp hello-world
```

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: hello-world
    labels:
      - dev.dozzle.group=myapp
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up File-Based Authentication with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for deploying Dozzle with simple file-based authentication, including volume mounts for Docker socket and user data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/authentication.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
      - /path/to/dozzle/data:/data
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    environment:
      DOZZLE_AUTH_PROVIDER: simple
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Connecting to Socket Proxy with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for connecting Dozzle to a Docker Socket Proxy. This setup doesn't require TLS and is suitable for private network environments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/remote-hosts.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    environment:
      DOZZLE_REMOTE_HOST: tcp://123.1.1.1:2375
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Dozzle Container Actions via Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: This Docker Compose configuration sets up Dozzle with container actions enabled through the DOZZLE_ENABLE_ACTIONS environment variable. It mounts the Docker socket and maps port 8080 to allow Dozzle to interact with Docker containers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/actions.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    environment:
      DOZZLE_ENABLE_ACTIONS: true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Dozzle with Label Filters
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for deploying Dozzle with label filters, restricting Dozzle to monitor only pods with specific labels in the Kubernetes cluster.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/k8s.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dozzle
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: dozzle
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: dozzle
    spec:
      serviceAccountName: pod-viewer
      containers:
        - name: dozzle
          image: amir20/dozzle:latest
          ports:
            - containerPort: 8080
          env:
            - name: DOZZLE_MODE
              value: "k8s"
            - name: DOZZLE_FILTER
              value: "env=prod"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Dozzle Container Actions via Docker Run Command
DESCRIPTION: This command runs Dozzle with container actions enabled using the --enable-actions flag. It mounts the Docker socket and exposes port 8080 to allow Dozzle to interact with Docker containers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/actions.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run --volume=/var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -p 8080:8080 amir20/dozzle --enable-actions
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring User-Specific Filters in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Example YAML configuration showing how to set different container visibility filters for admin and guest users in Dozzle.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/authentication.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
users:
  admin:
    email:
    name: Admin
    password: $2a$11$9ho4vY2LdJ/WBopFcsAS0uORC0x2vuFHQgT/yBqZyzclhHsoaIkzK
    filter:

  guest:
    email:
    name: Guest
    password: $2a$11$9ho4vY2LdJ/WBopFcsAS0uORC0x2vuFHQgT/yBqZyzclhHsoaIkzK
    filter: "label=com.example.app"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Debug Logging in Docker Compose for Dozzle
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration showing how to enable debug level logging for Dozzle by setting the DOZZLE_LEVEL environment variable. The configuration mounts the Docker socket and exposes port 8080.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/debugging.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    environment:
      DOZZLE_LEVEL: debug
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Custom Container Name in Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to set a custom container name for Dozzle using the dev.dozzle.name label in a Docker Compose configuration file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/container-names.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: hello-world
    labels:
      - dev.dozzle.name=hello
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Dozzle with Namespace Restriction
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for deploying Dozzle with a namespace restriction, limiting Dozzle to monitor only a specific namespace within the Kubernetes cluster.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/k8s.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: dozzle
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: dozzle
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: dozzle
    spec:
      serviceAccountName: pod-viewer
      containers:
        - name: dozzle
          image: amir20/dozzle:latest
          ports:
            - containerPort: 8080
          env:
            - name: DOZZLE_MODE
              value: "k8s"
            - name: DOZZLE_NAMESPACE
              value: "default"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Host Labels with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration demonstrating how to add labels to multiple remote hosts. Each host has a unique label that will be displayed in the Dozzle UI.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/remote-hosts.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
      - /path/to/certs:/certs
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    environment:
      DOZZLE_REMOTE_HOST: tcp://167.99.1.1:2376|foo.com,tcp://167.99.1.2:2376|bar.com
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting a Docker Socket Proxy with Minimal Access
DESCRIPTION: Command to run Docker Socket Proxy, exposing the Docker socket without requiring TLS. This configuration provides minimal access needed for Dozzle to monitor containers and system information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/remote-hosts.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker container run --privileged -e CONTAINERS=1 -e INFO=1 -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -p 2375:2375 tecnativa/docker-socket-proxy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Connecting to Dozzle Agent via Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for connecting to a Dozzle agent using environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/agent.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    environment:
      - DOZZLE_REMOTE_AGENT=agent:7007
    ports:
      - 8080:8080 # Dozzle UI port
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Standalone Agents to Dozzle in Swarm Mode
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration shows how to add standalone agents to Dozzle when running in Swarm Mode. It includes the DOZZLE_REMOTE_AGENT environment variable to connect to the agent.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/swarm-mode.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    environment:
      - DOZZLE_MODE=swarm
      - DOZZLE_REMOTE_AGENT=agent:7007
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    networks:
      - dozzle
    deploy:
      mode: global
networks:
  dozzle:
    driver: overlay
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Dozzle with Label Filter in Docker
DESCRIPTION: This command runs Dozzle in a Docker container with a filter to show only containers with a specific label. It mounts the Docker socket and exposes port 8080.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/filters.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run --volume=/var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -p 8080:8080 amir20/dozzle --filter label=color
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Forward Proxy Authentication with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for setting up Dozzle with forward proxy authentication to work with external authentication providers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/authentication.md#2025-04-21_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    environment:
      DOZZLE_AUTH_PROVIDER: forward-proxy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Dozzle with Custom Base Path using Docker
DESCRIPTION: This command runs Dozzle in a Docker container with a custom base path '/foobar' using the '--base' flag. It mounts the Docker socket and exposes port 8080.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/changing-base.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run --volume=/var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -p 8080:8080 amir20/dozzle --base /foobar
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Complete Authelia Integration with Dozzle
DESCRIPTION: Complete Docker Compose setup for integrating Dozzle with Authelia and Traefik for advanced authentication and access control.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/authentication.md#2025-04-21_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
networks:
  net:
    driver: bridge

services:
  authelia:
    image: authelia/authelia
    container_name: authelia
    volumes:
      - ./authelia:/config
    networks:
      - net
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.authelia.rule=Host(`authelia.example.com`)"
      - "traefik.http.routers.authelia.entrypoints=https"
      - "traefik.http.routers.authelia.tls=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.authelia.tls.options=default"
      - "traefik.http.middlewares.authelia.forwardauth.address=http://authelia:9091/api/verify?rd=https://authelia.example.com"
      - "traefik.http.middlewares.authelia.forwardauth.trustForwardHeader=true"
      - "traefik.http.middlewares.authelia.forwardauth.authResponseHeaders=Remote-User,Remote-Groups,Remote-Name,Remote-Email"
    expose:
      - 9091
    restart: unless-stopped

  traefik:
    image: traefik:2.10.5
    container_name: traefik
    volumes:
      - ./traefik:/etc/traefik
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    networks:
      - net
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.api.rule=Host(`traefik.example.com`)"
      - "traefik.http.routers.api.entrypoints=https"
      - "traefik.http.routers.api.service=api@internal"
      - "traefik.http.routers.api.tls=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.api.tls.options=default"
      - "traefik.http.routers.api.middlewares=authelia@docker"
    ports:
      - "80:80"
      - "443:443"
    command:
      - "--api"
      - "--providers.docker=true"
      - "--providers.docker.exposedByDefault=false"
      - "--providers.file.filename=/etc/traefik/certificates.yml"
      - "--entrypoints.http=true"
      - "--entrypoints.http.address=:80"
      - "--entrypoints.http.http.redirections.entrypoint.to=https"
      - "--entrypoints.http.http.redirections.entrypoint.scheme=https"
      - "--entrypoints.https=true"
      - "--entrypoints.https.address=:443"
      - "--log=true"
      - "--log.level=DEBUG"

  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    networks:
      - net
    environment:
      DOZZLE_AUTH_PROVIDER: forward-proxy
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.dozzle.rule=Host(`dozzle.example.com`)"
      - "traefik.http.routers.dozzle.entrypoints=https"
      - "traefik.http.routers.dozzle.tls=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.dozzle.tls.options=default"
      - "traefik.http.routers.dozzle.middlewares=authelia@docker"
    expose:
      - 8080
    restart: unless-stopped
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Dozzle with Forward Proxy Authentication via CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command-line example for running Dozzle with forward proxy authentication, which reads authentication headers from a proxy server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/authentication.md#2025-04-21_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ docker run -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -p 8080:8080 amir20/dozzle --auth-provider forward-proxy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Dozzle with Cloudflare Zero Trust Authentication
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for deploying Dozzle with Cloudflare Zero Trust authentication. Configures environment variables to use forward-proxy authentication with Cloudflare's authentication headers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/authentication.md#2025-04-21_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    networks:
      - net
    environment:
      DOZZLE_AUTH_PROVIDER: forward-proxy
      DOZZLE_AUTH_HEADER_USER: Cf-Access-Authenticated-User-Email
      DOZZLE_AUTH_HEADER_EMAIL: Cf-Access-Authenticated-User-Email
      DOZZLE_AUTH_HEADER_NAME: Cf-Access-Authenticated-User-Email
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    expose:
      - 8080
    restart: unless-stopped
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Dozzle with Podman
DESCRIPTION: Podman run command to start Dozzle with the Podman socket mounted appropriately.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
podman run --volume=/run/user/1000/podman/podman.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -d -p 8080:8080 docker.io/amir20/dozzle:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Following Log Files with Docker Compose and Alpine
DESCRIPTION: A Docker Compose configuration that creates a persistent container to follow a log file on disk. This setup uses Alpine to tail the file with minimal resource usage and can survive server reboots.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/log-files-on-disk.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle-from-file:
    container_name: dozzle-from-file
    image: alpine
    volumes:
      - /var/log/system.log:/var/log/stream.log
    command:
      - tail
      - -f
      - /var/log/stream.log
    network_mode: none
    restart: unless-stopped
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Connecting to Dozzle Agent via Docker CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command to connect to a Dozzle agent using Docker run command with remote agent configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/agent.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run -p 8080:8080 amir20/dozzle:latest --remote-agent agent-ip:7007
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Filters for Dozzle Agent
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration showing how to set up container filters for a Dozzle agent.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/agent.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle-agent:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    command: agent
    environment:
      - DOZZLE_FILTER=label=color
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro
```

TITLE: Running Dozzle in Agent Mode
DESCRIPTION: This command runs Dozzle in agent mode, which allows monitoring a different Docker host. It mounts the Docker socket and exposes port 8080, while specifying a remote agent IP and port.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/supported-env-vars.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run --volume=/var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -p 8080:8080 amir20/dozzle --remote-agent remote-ip:7007
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Custom Certificate Configuration for Dozzle Agent
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for setting up custom TLS certificates using Docker secrets.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/agent.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  agent:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    command: agent
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    secrets:
      - source: cert
        target: /dozzle_cert.pem
      - source: key
        target: /dozzle_key.pem
    ports:
      - 7007:7007
secrets:
  cert:
    file: ./cert.pem
  key:
    file: ./key.pem
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Dozzle with Custom Hostname Using Docker Command
DESCRIPTION: This command runs Dozzle in a Docker container with a custom hostname 'mywebsite.xyz'. It mounts the Docker socket and exposes port 8080 for web access.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/hostname.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run --volume=/var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -p 8080:8080 amir20/dozzle --hostname mywebsite.xyz
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Dozzle with Docker Secrets
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for setting up Dozzle authentication using Docker secrets to securely manage user credentials.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/authentication.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    environment:
      - DOZZLE_AUTH_PROVIDER=simple
    secrets:
      - source: users
        target: /data/users.yml
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
      - dozzle:/data
secrets:
  users:
    file: users.yml
volumes:
  dozzle:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Host Labels with CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command line example showing how to add a custom label to a remote host connection. The label is appended to the connection string with a pipe character and will be displayed in the UI.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/remote-hosts.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run --volume=/var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -p 8080:8080 amir20/dozzle --remote-host tcp://123.1.1.1:2375|foobar.com
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Simple Authentication for Dozzle in Swarm Mode
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration demonstrates how to set up simple authentication for Dozzle in Swarm Mode using Docker secrets to store the users.yml file. It includes environment variables for authentication and debug logging.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/swarm-mode.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    environment:
      - DOZZLE_LEVEL=debug
      - DOZZLE_MODE=swarm
      - DOZZLE_AUTH_PROVIDER=simple
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    secrets:
      - source: users
        target: /data/users.yml

    ports:
      - "8080:8080"
    networks:
      - dozzle
    deploy:
      mode: global

networks:
  dozzle:
    driver: overlay
secrets:
  users:
    file: users.yml
```

TITLE: Mounting Local Log Files with Alpine using Docker Run
DESCRIPTION: A Docker run command that mounts a host system log file into an Alpine container and uses tail to follow it, allowing Dozzle to access logs written to files on disk.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/log-files-on-disk.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run -v /var/log/system.log:/var/log/test.log alpine tail -f /var/log/test.log
```

TITLE: Configuring Dozzle with Label Filter in Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: This Docker Compose configuration sets up Dozzle with a filter to show only containers with a specific label. It mounts the Docker socket, exposes port 8080, and sets the filter using an environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/filters.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    environment:
      DOZZLE_FILTER: label=color
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating UUID and engine-id using Ansible for Dozzle with Podman
DESCRIPTION: This Ansible snippet creates the /var/lib/docker directory and generates a UUID derived from the hostname, writing it to the engine-id file. This helps resolve issues with Dozzle when using Podman.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/podman.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- name: Create /var/lib/docker
  ansible.builtin.file:
    path: /var/lib/docker
    state: directory
    mode: "755"

- name: Create engine-id and derive UUID from hostname
  ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
    path: /var/lib/docker/engine-id
    line: "{{ hostname | to_uuid }}"
    create: true
    mode: "0644"
    insertafter: "EOF"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Connecting to Remote Docker Hosts with TLS Using CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command line example for running Dozzle in a container with TLS certificates mounted to monitor remote Docker hosts. The certificates must be mounted to the /certs directory and multiple remote hosts can be specified.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/remote-hosts.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v /path/to/certs:/certs -p 8080:8080 amir20/dozzle --remote-host tcp://167.99.1.1:2376 --remote-host tcp://167.99.1.2:2376
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Custom Certificates for Dozzle Agent
DESCRIPTION: Commands for generating custom TLS certificates for secure agent communication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/agent.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ openssl genpkey -algorithm Ed25519 -out key.pem
$ openssl req -new -key key.pem -out request.csr -subj "/C=US/ST=California/L=San Francisco/O=My Company"
$ openssl x509 -req -in request.csr -signkey key.pem -out cert.pem -days 365
```

LANGUAGE: sh

```
docker run -p 8080:8080 amir20/dozzle --remote-host tcp://123.1.1.1:2375
```

TITLE: Counting Log Entries with SQL
DESCRIPTION: A simple SQL query that counts the total number of log entries in the logs table. This is useful for getting a quick overview of the volume of logs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/sql-engine.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM logs
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Nginx Proxy for Dozzle with Custom Base Path
DESCRIPTION: This Nginx configuration sets up a proxy for Dozzle with a custom base path '/foobar'. It includes necessary proxy settings for WebSocket support and disables caching and buffering.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/changing-base.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: nginx
CODE:
```
location ^~ /foobar/ {
    set $upstream_app dozzle;
    set $upstream_port 8080;
    set $upstream_proto http;
    proxy_pass $upstream_proto://$upstream_app:$upstream_port;

    chunked_transfer_encoding off;
    proxy_buffering off;
    proxy_cache off;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
    proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
}
```

----------------------------------------

```
title: Home

hero:

    icon: üè†

    link: /guide/remote-hosts
    linkText: Learn More
    icon: üåê
  - title: SQL Engine
    details: Use SQL queries to analyze logs inside your browser with WebAssembly and DuckDB.
    icon: üìä
    linkText: Learn More

    details: Connect to remote hosts securely with agents, providing a more secure way to connect to remote hosts.
    icon: üîí
    link: /guide/agent
    linkText: Learn More
  - title: Swarm Support
    link: /guide/swarm-mode
    details: Supports Docker Swarm mode, allowing you to manage and monitor your swarm clusters across multiple hosts.
    icon: üê≥

  - title: Sponsored by Docker OSS

    icon: üìú
    link: https://hub.docker.com/r/amir20/dozzle
    linkText: Docker Hub
```

TITLE: Configuring Dozzle Healthcheck in Docker Compose YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet demonstrates how to configure the Dozzle service with healthcheck in a Docker Compose file. It sets up the container to run the 'dozzle healthcheck' command every 3 seconds, with specific timeout, retry, and start period settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/healthcheck.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "/dozzle", "healthcheck"]
      interval: 3s
      timeout: 30s
      retries: 5
      start_period: 30s
```

----------------------------------------

SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/faq.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

CODE:
```
cgroup_enable=cpuset cgroup_enable=memory cgroup_memory=1
```

TITLE: Dozzle Agent Healthcheck Configuration

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  dozzle-agent:
    image: amir20/dozzle:latest
    command: agent
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "/dozzle", "healthcheck"]
      interval: 5s
      retries: 5
      start_period: 5s
      start_interval: 5s
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro
    ports:
      - 7007:7007
```

```
services:
```

TITLE: Configuring Nginx Proxy for Dozzle
DESCRIPTION: Nginx configuration to disable buffering for Dozzle's SSE connections. This setup prevents log streaming issues by disabling proxy buffering and caching for the /api endpoint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/faq.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: nginx
CODE:
```
server {
    ...

    location / {
        proxy_pass                  http://<dozzle.container.ip.address>:8080;
    }

    location /api {
        proxy_pass                  http://<dozzle.container.ip.address>:8080;

        proxy_buffering             off;
        proxy_cache                 off;
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Traefik Compression Middleware
DESCRIPTION: Traefik configuration to exclude text/event-stream from compression, preventing log streaming issues in Dozzle when accessed through Traefik reverse proxy.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/faq.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
http:
  middlewares:
    middlewares-compress:
      compress:
        excludedContentTypes:
          - text/event-stream
```


TITLE: VitePress Team Page Component Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Configures a team page layout using VitePress components and defines team member data with social media links and profile information. Uses Vue.js script setup syntax to initialize components and data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/team.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: vue

```
import {
  VPTeamPage,
  VPTeamPageTitle,
  VPTeamMembers
} from 'vitepress/theme'

<VPTeamPage>
  <VPTeamPageTitle>
    <template #title>
      Team
    </template>
    <template #lead>
      Dozzle is created and maintained by the following people.
    </template>
  </VPTeamPageTitle>

    :members="members"
  />
</VPTeamPage>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Custom Container Name Using Docker Run Command
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set a custom container name for Dozzle using the dev.dozzle.name label with Docker run command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/container-names.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run --label dev.dozzle.name=hello hello-world
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking Podman Remote Socket Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Command to verify if Podman has the remote socket enabled, which is required for Dozzle.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
podman info
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example Users Configuration File
DESCRIPTION: Sample users.yml file that defines an admin user with email, name, and bcrypt-hashed password for Dozzle's file-based authentication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/authentication.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
users:
  admin:
    email: me@email.net
    name: Admin
    password: $2a$11$9ho4vY2LdJ/WBopFcsAS0uORC0x2vuFHQgT/yBqZyzclhHsoaIkzK
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Virtual Table from JSON Logs with DuckDB
DESCRIPTION: This SQL query creates a virtual table named 'logs' by unnesting JSON log data from a source file. It's used internally by Dozzle to prepare log data for SQL querying.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/sql-engine.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
CREATE TABLE logs AS SELECT unnest(m) FROM 'logs.json'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Filtering Logs by a Specific Field
DESCRIPTION: This SQL query filters logs to only show entries with a 'level' field set to 'error'. Useful for isolating error messages in your logs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/sql-engine.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT * FROM logs WHERE level = 'error'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Grouping and Counting Logs by a Field
DESCRIPTION: This SQL query groups logs by the 'level' field and counts the occurrences of each level. It's helpful for understanding the distribution of log levels in your data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/amir20/dozzle/blob/master/docs/guide/sql-engine.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT level, COUNT(*) FROM logs GROUP BY level
```
